mobile_apps.long_description: NIAAA Spectrum is the Institute’s online webzine. With engaging feature articles, short news updates, and colorful graphics, Spectrum offers accessible and relevant information on NIAAA and the alcohol research field for a wide range of audiences.

mobile_apps.name: Anticoagulation Manager
mobile_apps.short_description: The Anticoagulation Manager is a resource for clinicians that will guide them to utilize the appropriate laboratory testing and administer the appropriate anticoagulant drug in the correct dosage and at the right frequency to patients.
mobile_apps.long_description: The Anticoagulation Manager is a mobile application developed through the collaborative efforts of the CDC and the Georgia Institute of Technology. Since the determination of the correct type and dose of anticoagulant drugs can be challenging, this application is a resource for clinicians to appropriately order laboratory testing and choose anticoagulant drugs for the various indications. It gives clinicians evidence-based, accessible, and accurate information when prescribing anticoagulants to prevent and/or treat abnormal clotting states.

mobile_apps.name: Aquatic Inspector iPad App
mobile_apps.short_description: Aquatic Inspector provides a digital version of the inspection form from CDC’s Model Aquatic Health Code.
mobile_apps.long_description: Aquatic Inspector provides a digital version of CDC's Model Aquatic Health Code(MAHC) inspection form, along with embedded full MAHC text. Aquatic Inspector allows inspectors to integrate the latest evidence-based guidance into routine, follow-up, and investigative inspections of aquatic facilities.

mobile_apps.name: CDC DentalCheck
mobile_apps.short_description: Dental health care personnel can use this app to periodically assess practices in their facility and ensure they are meeting the minimum expectations for safe care.
mobile_apps.long_description:
DentalCheck is developed directly from the Infection Prevention Checklist for Dental Settings. DHCP can use this app to periodically assess practices in their facility and ensure they are meeting the minimum expectations for safe care. The infection prevention coordinator and other staff trained in infection prevention are encouraged to use this app at least annually to assess the status of their administrative policies and practices, and also engage in direct observation of personnel and patient-care practices. 

While the information included in this app reflects existing evidence-based guidelines produced by the CDC, it is not intended as a replacement for more extensive guidelines.

Key Features
•	Check Yes/No to acknowledge compliance with a list of administrative policies or observed practices 
•	Summary of basic infection prevention principles and recommendations for dental health care settings
•	Ability to export results for records management 
Provides links to full guidelines and source documents that users can reference for more detailed background and recommendations.

mobile_apps.name: BAM! Dining Decisions
mobile_apps.short_description: Learn to make smart food choices with Kendra from CDC’s BAM! Body and Mind.
mobile_apps.long_description:
Learn to make smart food choices with Kendra from CDC’s BAM! Body and Mind. 

In each level you’ll sort foods coming down a conveyor belt into three categories: Go, Slow, or Whoa. Earn points by putting foods into the correct category.

Presented by BAM! Body and Mind, an online resource giving kids information they need to make healthy lifestyle choices. BAM! Body and Mind was created by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS). http://www.cdc.gov/bam/  http://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/health/educational/wecan/eat-right/index.htm

mobile_apps.name: ErgoMine
mobile_apps.short_description: ErgoMine provides ergonomics audits for three types of operations in the mining industry (bagging operations, maintenance and repair operations, and haul truck operations).
mobile_apps.long_description: ErgoMine provides ergonomics audits for three types of operations in the mining industry (bagging operations, maintenance and repair operations, and haul truck operations). Each of the three audits has modules, and the user can choose to complete all or some of the modules. The audit results can be emailed to multiple addresses, and recommendations to address each identified ergonomics and safety problem are provided within the results.

mobile_apps.name: Wildflowers of Cedar Breaks National Monument
mobile_apps.short_description: Find details on the large variety of wildflowers found at Cedar Breaks National Monument. This is the official wildflower app of the monument used for the annual Wildflower Festival each year.
mobile_apps.long_description: Find details on the large variety of wildflowers found at Cedar Breaks National Monument. This is the official wildflower app of the monument used for the annual Wildflower Festival each year.

mobile_apps.name: Cedar Breaks Alpine Pond Trail
mobile_apps.short_description: Learn about Geology, Wildlife, Trees, and Mysteries of Cedar Breaks National Monument. Enjoy activities about the monument. This is the official Alpine Pond trail app of the monument.
mobile_apps.long_description: Learn about Geology, Wildlife, Trees, and Mysteries of Cedar Breaks National Monument. Enjoy activities about the monument. This is the official Alpine Pond trail app of the monument.

mobile_apps.name: FluView
mobile_apps.short_description: Explore Influenza-Like Illness (ILI) Activity Levels across the US, view ILI trends over several weeks, and get on-demand access to state health department websites for local surveillance information
mobile_apps.long_description:
This is the official FluView Influenza-Like Illness Activity mobile application created by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

With this application, you can:
- Explore Influenza-Like Illness (ILI) Activity Levels across the US
- View ILI trends over several weeks
- Get on-demand access to state health department websites for local surveillance information

One of seven FluView surveillance components is to track information received from the U.S. Outpatient Influenza-like Illness Surveillance Network (ILINet). This application displays ILI activity levels based on the percent of outpatient visits in a jurisdiction due to ILI compared to the average percent of ILI visits that occur during weeks with little or no influenza virus circulation (non-influenza weeks). ILINet consists of more than 3,000 health care providers in all 50 states, the District of Columbia and the U.S. Virgin Islands reporting more than 30 million patient visits each year.

mobile_apps.name: CDC HEADS UP Concussion and Helmet Safety app
mobile_apps.short_description: The CDC HEADS UP Concussion and Helmet Safety app will help you learn how to spot a possible concussion and what to do if you think your child or teen has a concussion or other serious brain injury.
mobile_apps.long_description: The CDC HEADS UP Concussion and Helmet Safety app will help you learn how to spot a possible concussion and what to do if you think your child or teen has a concussion or other serious brain injury. The application also includes a 3D helmet fit feature that teaches about proper helmet fit, safety and care.

mobile_apps.name: NPS Palo Alto Battlefield OnCell Tour
mobile_apps.short_description: Mobile tour of U.S.-Mexican War and Civil War sites.
mobile_apps.long_description: Mobile tour of U.S.-Mexican War and Civil War sites.

mobile_apps.name: NPS GoldenGate
mobile_apps.short_description: Official NPS app for Golden Gate National Recreation Area
mobile_apps.long_description: The NPS Golden Gate app is designed to tailor your park visit according to your interests and time. Make an itinerary that includes a walk through the redwoods at Muir Woods (starting 1/16 reservations required to visit), a visit to the historic Presidio, a trip to the Mori Point frog ponds, or anywhere else your curiosity takes you!

mobile_apps.name: FluView
mobile_apps.short_description: Explore Influenza-Like Illness (ILI) Activity Levels across the US, view ILI trends over several weeks, and get on-demand access to state health department websites for local surveillance information.
mobile_apps.long_description:
With this application, you can:
- Explore Influenza-Like Illness (ILI) Activity Levels across the US
- View ILI trends over several weeks
- Get on-demand access to state health department websites for local surveillance information

mobile_apps.name: CDC HEADS UP Concussion and Helmet Safety
mobile_apps.short_description: The CDC HEADS UP Concussion and Helmet Safety app will help you learn how to spot a possible concussion and what to do if you think your child or teen has a concussion or other serious brain injury.
mobile_apps.long_description: The CDC HEADS UP Concussion and Helmet Safety app will help you learn how to spot and what to do if you think your child or teen has a concussion or other serious brain injury. The application includes a helmet fit feature that teaches about proper helmet fit, safety and care as well as providing other tools and materials for youth and high school sports coaches, parents, athletes, and school and health care professionals that provide important information on preventing, recognizing, and responding to concussion.

mobile_apps.name: HEAT Safety Tool App (OSHA-NIOSH)
mobile_apps.short_description: The OSHA-NIOSH Heat Safety Tool is a useful resource for planning outdoor work activities based on how hot it feels throughout the day.
mobile_apps.long_description: The OSHA-NIOSH Heat Safety Tool is a useful resource for planning outdoor work activities based on how hot it feels throughout the day. Featuring real-time heat index and hourly forecasts, specific to your location, as well as occupational safety and health recommendations from OSHA and NIOSH.

mobile_apps.name: Milestone Tracker
mobile_apps.short_description: Track your child’s milestones from age 2 months to 5 years with CDC’s easy-to-use illustrated checklists; get tips from CDC for encouraging your child’s development; and find out what to do if you are ever concerned about how your child is developing.
mobile_apps.long_description:
Milestones matter! Track your child’s milestones from age 2 months to 5 years with CDC’s easy-to-use illustrated checklists; get tips from CDC for encouraging your child’s development; and find out what to do if you are ever concerned about how your child is developing.

From birth to age 5, your child should reach milestones in how he or she plays, learns, speaks, acts and moves. Photos and videos in this app illustrate each milestone and make tracking them for your child easy and fun!

mobile_apps.name: MMWR Express
mobile_apps.short_description: MMWR Express provides fast access to the blue summary boxes in MMWR’s Weekly Report
mobile_apps.long_description:
The Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report (MMWR) Series is prepared by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Often called “the voice of CDC,” the MMWR Series is the agency’s primary vehicle for scientific publication of timely, reliable, authoritative, accurate, objective, and useful public health information and recommendations.

This application is a result of collaboration between the Informatics Innovation Unit and MMWR within the Division of Public Health Information Dissemination, Center for Surveillance, Epidemiology, and Laboratory Sciences.

mobile_apps.name: Prevent Group B Strep (GBS)
mobile_apps.short_description: Obstetric and neonatal providers— prevent and manage group B strep in newborns with patient-specific guidance that is consistent with the 2010 Guidelines for the Prevention of Perinatal GBS Disease.
mobile_apps.long_description:
This is the Prevent Group B Strep App created by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) with the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP), American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG), American Academy of Family Physicians (AAFP), and the American College of Nurse-Midwives (ACNM).

With this application, you can:

1. Obtain customized, evidence-based recommendations to prevent neonatal GBS disease based on a maternal and neonatal clinical information.
2.Obtain optimal antibiotic recommendations for GBS prevention.

mobile_apps.name: PTT Advisor Support
mobile_apps.short_description: CDC’s PTT Advisor offers clinicians a tool to quickly select the appropriate follow-up tests to evaluate patients with a prolonged partial thromboplastin time (PTT) laboratory result and a normal prothrombin time (PT) laboratory result.
mobile_apps.long_description: CDC's PTT Advisor offers clinicians a tool to quickly select the appropriate follow-up tests to evaluate patients with a prolonged partial thromboplastin time (PTT) laboratory result and a normal prothrombin time (PT) laboratory result.  PTT Advisor will run on your iPhone, iPod touch or iPad.  PTT Advisor has been created by CDC in collaboration with experts in diagnostic coagulation with a collective experience of more than 50 years in the field.  CDC works 24/7 keeping America safe from health, safety and security threats, both foreign and domestic. Whether diseases start at home or abroad, are chronic or acute, curable or preventable, human error or deliberate attack, CDC fights it and supports communities and citizens to prevent it.

mobile_apps.name: TravWell
mobile_apps.short_description: TravWell helps you plan for safe and healthy international travel.
mobile_apps.long_description: CDC’s TravWell app helps you plan for safe and healthy international travel. Build a trip to get destination-specific vaccine recommendations, a checklist of what you need to do to prepare for travel, and a customizable healthy travel packing list. The app also lets you store travel documents, keep a record of your medications and immunizations, and set reminders to get vaccine booster doses or take medicines while you’re traveling.

mobile_apps.name: Vaccine Schedules
mobile_apps.short_description: Access up-to-date CDC recommended immunization schedules and footnotes.
mobile_apps.long_description:
Quick access from CDC to ACIP-recommended immunization schedules, complete with footnotes. Intended for healthcare professionals recommending and administering vaccines to infants, children, adolescents, and adults.

This app is one of an expanding collection of applications from CDC on a variety of specific topics, each optimized for your mobile device. When your device is connected, content is automatically updated so you have the most up-to-date information.

mobile_apps.name: U.S. Medical Eligibility Criteria for Contraceptive Use
mobile_apps.short_description: The U.S. Medical Eligibility Criteria for Contraceptive Use comprises recommendations for the use of specific contraceptive methods by patients who have certain characteristics or medical conditions.
mobile_apps.long_description: The U.S. Medical Eligibility Criteria for Contraceptive Use comprises recommendations for the use of specific contraceptive methods by patients who have certain characteristics or medical conditions. The U.S. Selected Practice Recommendations for Contraceptive Use addresses a select group of common, yet sometimes controversial or complex, issues regarding initiation and use of specific contraceptive methods. The app is developed directly from the CDC Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report (MMWR) by the Division of Reproductive Health and covers more than 60 characteristics or medical conditions (U.S. MEC) and numerous clinical situations (U.S. SPR). These recommendations are intended to assist healthcare providers when they counsel women, men, and couples about contraceptive method choice and use. Although these recommendations are meant to serve as a source or clinical guidance, healthcare providers should always consider the individual clinical circumstances of each person seeking family planning services.

mobile_apps.name: CDC Opioid Guideline
mobile_apps.short_description: The CDC Opioid Prescribing Guideline Mobile Application (App) serves as a quick reference guide for healthcare professionals to help apply the recommendations of the CDC Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain in clinical practice.
mobile_apps.long_description: The CDC Opioid Prescribing Guideline Mobile Application (App) serves as a quick reference guide for healthcare professionals to help apply the recommendations of the CDC Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain in clinical practice. The tool is intended to educate providers about the prescription opioid overdose epidemic and to inform clinical decision-making

mobile_apps.name: The Yellow Book
mobile_apps.short_description: CDC Health Information for International Travel (commonly called the Yellow Book) is the definitive resource for healthcare providers and individuals seeking consultation in advance of international travel.
mobile_apps.long_description: The fully revised and updated CDC Yellow Book 2018 app delivers the U.S. government’s most current travel health guidelines, including pre-travel vaccine recommendations, destination-specific health advice, and easy-to-reference maps, tables, and charts. Authored by a team of the world’s most esteemed travel medicine experts, this app best codifies the U.S. Government’s latest travel guidelines to staying healthy anywhere in the world.

mobile_apps.name: LRN Rule-Out Refer
mobile_apps.short_description: The Laboratory Response Network Rule-Out and Refer app makes it easy to access important information regarding six potential bioterrorism agents including Bacillus anthracis, Brucella species, Yersinia pestis, Francisella tularensis, Burkholderia pseudomallei, and Burkholderia mallei.
mobile_apps.long_description: The Laboratory Response Network Rule-Out and Refer app makes it easy to access important information regarding six potential bioterrorism agents including Bacillus anthracis, Brucella species, Yersinia pestis, Francisella tularensis, Burkholderia pseudomallei, and Burkholderia mallei. This app provides information regarding biosafety, shipping, and select agent compliance associated with each pathogen to ensure that the information you need is at your fingertips! The app also aids sentinel labs, such as clinics, hospitals, and public health agencies by providing a tool in the “rule-out and refer” decision with easy to use flowcharts detailing the identification steps. Agent specific images and video examples guide the user in making accurate and efficient decisions.

mobile_apps.name: Toolbox Talks
mobile_apps.short_description: The purpose of these Toolbox Talks is to provide information related to workplace hazards and risks to workers at Stone, Sand, Gravel, and Aggregates (SSGA) operations.
mobile_apps.long_description: The CDC/NIOSH Toolbox Talks are designed to provide information related to workplace hazards and risks to workers at Stone, Sand, Gravel, and Aggregates (SSGA) operations. This information can be used to increase workers’ health and safety. This series of Toolbox Talks was created using data from two sources: interviews with SSGA mine workers about hazards and risks at their worksite, and nonfatal and fatal injury data reported to the Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) during the years 2009-2014. Each Toolbox Talk includes a quote from a mine worker to demonstrate a first person experience with a hazard or risk. This first person experience is then linked to MSHA injury data to show that these experiences are consistent with the realities of accidents, injuries, and fatalities. Finally, several questions are included that can be used to start a discussion about a specific Toolbox Talk topic - for instance, questions for the slips and falls topic are focused on having mine workers identify where slips and falls are likely to occur at their mine site and ways mine workers can protect themselves from slip and fall injuries. Altogether there are 13 talks included in this series.

mobile_apps.name: Drugs@FDA Express
mobile_apps.short_description: Search and browse FDA-approved brand name and generic prescription and over-the-counter human drugs and biological therapeutic products by drug name, active ingredient, or application number.
mobile_apps.long_description:
Search and browse by drug name, active ingredient, or application number.

Last 7 Days’ Approvals 
A list of recent approval actions, organized by date. The “Last 7 Days’ Approvals” option will display recently-approved submissions with submission types ORIG and SUPPL. Only labeling or efficacy supplements will be listed, with links to approved labeling, when available.

Links to FDA Websites:
The mobile app will link to the full Drugs@FDA website 

FDA Help & Support links:
Drugs@FDA Glossary 
Drugs@FDA Frequently Asked Questions
Division of Drug Information, FDA/CDER (druginfo@fda.hhs.gov)

mobile_apps.name: Orange Book Express 2.0
mobile_apps.short_description: Get information about drug products approved by FDA based on safety and effectiveness, find patent and exclusivity information, and look up drugs that have the same therapeutic effect.
mobile_apps.long_description:
New in this version:

• Search results and drug listings now clarify which listed drugs are reference listed drugs (RLDs) and which are reference standards. 
• The application now uses HTTPS encryption to provide a secure connection.

With FDA’s Orange Book Express app, it’s now faster and easier to find information about:

• Drug products approved on the basis of safety and effectiveness by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA)
• Information about patents and exclusivity

Orange Book Express allows you to:

• Search by Active Ingredient or Proprietary Name; Applicant Holder (Firm); Application Number; or Patent Number.
• Search all marketing statuses (Rx, OTC, Discontinued) with one search.
• Look up patent and exclusivity information.
• Identify Reference Listed Drugs (RLDs) and determine if a drug product has a therapeutic equivalent.
• Browse Patent Delistings and Newly Added Patents.

mobile_apps.name: NDC Express
mobile_apps.short_description: Look up the unique National Drug Code (NDC) numbers of all drug products commercially distributed in the U.S.
mobile_apps.long_description:
Currently, drug products are identified and reported using a unique, 10-digit, three-segment number. This is called the National Drug Code, most often referred to as the NDC number. The FDA assigns the first segment, the labeler code. A “labeler” is a firm that manufactures or distributes the drug, including drug re-packagers or re-labelers. This segment contains 4 or 5 digits. The second segment, the product code, identifies the drug, including the specific strength, dosage form, and formulation. The third segment, the package code, identifies package sizes and types. The firm assigns the product and package codes. 

All drugs entering U.S. commercial distribution are required to be listed with the FDA. Firms submit the NDCs numbers assigned to the drugs they manufacture or distribute as part of their listing requirements. The FDA publishes these NDC numbers and other information submitted the online NDC Directory The assignment of an NDC number does not in any way denote FDA approval of the product.

mobile_apps.name: Drug Shortages 2
mobile_apps.short_description: Quickly find and get alerts about current drug shortages, resolved shortages, and discontinuations of drug products.
mobile_apps.long_description:
*** Important Note: We highly recommend that you uninstall Drug Shortages 1 before installing Drugs Shortages 2 to avoid an installation error. ***

Drug Shortages 2 includes an Alerts feature. You can opt in to receive notifications on your mobile device when FDA adds or updates shortage information about a drug product or one or more drugs within a selected therapeutic category.

Access to drug shortage information is now easier and faster. FDA has developed an app that allows users to quickly identify current drug shortages, resolved shortages, and discontinuations of drug products. This app was developed to accelerate public access to important – and sometimes critical -- information about drug shortages. The application uses a searchable database to provide real-time information to key stakeholders, including health care practitioners and pharmacists. The app:

• helps health care practitioners make quick decisions about patient treatment
• allows users to search for a generic name or active ingredient, and browse by alphabetic list or therapeutic category
• provides an option to receive notifications when FDA updates information about a drug shortage
• provides information on how to report a shortage or supply issue, and links to other resources from FDA and the American Society of Health-System Pharmacists.

mobile_apps.name: CBP Border Wait Times
mobile_apps.short_description: The CBP Border Wait Times (BWT) app provides estimated wait times and open lane status 24/7 at ports of entry that process commercial vehicles, passenger vehicles, and pedestrians.
mobile_apps.long_description: Knowing land border wait times at the various ports of entry into the United States from both Canada and Mexico can aid the traveler in making an informed decision on when and where to cross the border. The U.S. Customs and Border Protection's Border Wait Times (BWT) app provides estimated wait times and open lane status 24/7 at ports of entry that process commercial vehicles, passenger vehicles, and pedestrians. The BWT app breaks down wait times at each crossing by lane type (Standard, Sentri, FAST, Ready Lane, Nexus, etc.) The BWT app is a free service provided by the Department of Homeland Security/U.S. Customs and Border Protection.

mobile_apps.name: CBP Jobs
mobile_apps.short_description: This official U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) application is designed for those interested in a career with CBP and who have been tentatively selected by CBP for a law enforcement position.
mobile_apps.long_description:
This official U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) application is designed for those interested in a career with CBP and who have been tentatively selected by CBP for a law enforcement position. CBP employs a variety of frontline positions--Border Patrol Agents, Customs and Border Protection Officers, Agricultural Specialists, Air Interdiction Agents, Aviation Enforcement Agents, and Marine Interdiction Agents--to protect the American people and national economy, and safeguard the U.S. air, land, and maritime borders.

Once you’ve applied and been tentatively selected for a frontline position, CBP Jobs allows you to track your progression through the hiring process. The app also features an easy-to-use interface and provides notifications as you move from one phase to the next. 

CBP Jobs offers a reliable and effective way to ensure you’re informed and up-to-date on your hiring status and on your way to becoming a part of the homeland’s defense.

mobile_apps.name: CBP ROAM
mobile_apps.short_description: The official CBP ROAM App (formerly OARS) from U.S. Customs and Border Protection allows pleasure boaters and other eligible travelers who arrive at remote locations to report their arrival online.
mobile_apps.long_description:
The official CBP ROAM App (formerly OARS) from U.S. Customs and Border Protection allows pleasure boaters and other eligible travelers who arrive at remote locations to report their arrival online. In addition to submitting a report of arrival, pleasure boaters who are not currently enrolled in a Trusted Traveler Program, Local Boater Option, or I-68 program who are currently required to report in person may be eligible for a video inspection.
Disclaimer: This is a pilot version only for use in limited areas. Contact your local Port of Entry for guidance.
Create a trip by adding travelers, your mode of travel, your location, and contact information.
After you submit a trip, you may receive a push notification on your device to start a video chat with a CBP Officer to finish reporting your entry into the United States.

mobile_apps.name: CareerOneStop Mobile App
mobile_apps.short_description: Your source for career exploration, training & jobs
mobile_apps.long_description: Get quick access to mobile resources to meet your career, employment and training needs. Search in any U.S. location for local jobs, salaries, and training credentials or programs. Also, locate your closest American Job Center to access job search assistance; find your state’s unemployment insurance program; and connect with a variety of local help organizations. CareerOneStop also provides user-friendly labor market information, matches military experience to civilian jobs; and features an Interest Assessment, and Occupation Profiles.

mobile_apps.name: CareerOneStop Mobile App
mobile_apps.short_description: Your source for career exploration, training & jobs.
mobile_apps.long_description: Get quick access to mobile resources to meet your career, employment and training needs. Search in any U.S. location for local jobs, salaries, and training credentials or programs. Also, locate your closest American Job Center to access job search assistance; find your state’s unemployment insurance program; and connect with a variety of local help organizations. CareerOneStop also provides user-friendly labor market information, matches military experience to civilian jobs; and features an Interest Assessment, and Occupation Profiles.

mobile_apps.name: Pool Safely Adventures of Splish and Splash
mobile_apps.short_description: Mobile game for CPSC's Pool Safely campaign
mobile_apps.long_description: Learn tips for safe swimming with Pool Safely's Splish and Splash.

mobile_apps.name: GSA Federal Credit Union
mobile_apps.short_description: As a not-for-profit financial cooperative, GSA Federal Credit Union offers a different approach to banking.
mobile_apps.long_description: GSA FCU Mobile Banking lets you bank whenever and wherever you are. Remotely deposit checks, transfer money in and out of your GSA account, view account information and much more.

mobile_apps.name: RegInfo Mobile
mobile_apps.short_description: Provides information about upcoming federal regulations and forms.
mobile_apps.long_description:
With RegInfo Mobile, you can have information about upcoming federal regulations and forms at your fingertips. The White House Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and the General Services Administration (GSA) partnered to bring you a mobile version of Reginfo.gov, an online look into agency rulemakings that are on the books, planned, or under review by OMB’s Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA). RegInfo Mobile also provides information about forms and other information collections that OIRA has approved or is currently reviewing under the Paperwork Reduction Act (PRA). With RegInfo Mobile, we’re bringing direct access to all of this information, and more, to the palm of your hand!

• Unified Agenda of Regulatory and Deregulatory Actions and the Regulatory Plan
• Current and historical information since Fall 1995 edition
• View detailed information about regulations, including regulation identifier number (RIN) title, abstract, effects on society and completed/planned actions for the next six months
• NEW! – Timeline Chart… an interactive visualization of when proposed and final regulations are published, OIRA reviews of regulations, related information collections, and more!
• Regulatory Reviews
• View detailed information about OIRA’s pending and concluded reviews of significant rulemakings
• Meetings with the Public
• Browse the log of past and scheduled public meetings about regulations under OIRA review
• Information regarding each meeting includes RIN, the title of the regulation, date, participants and affiliations, and written materials submitted by the public
• Information Collection Requests under the PRA
• View detailed information on OIRA’s pending and concluded reviews of agency information collection requests (ICRs), including OMB Control Number, expiration date, requested/approved burden on the public, supporting statements, forms, etc.
• Keyword search that returns results for matching RINs, regulatory reviews and ICRs
• Subscribe to a RIN and receive notifications when something happens

mobile_apps.name: Per Diem for Continental U.S (Federal)
mobile_apps.short_description: Allows travelers to look up Federal government per diem rates by city/state and ZIP code in locations throughout the United States and its territories.
mobile_apps.long_description: This app allows travelers to look up Federal government per diem rates by city/state and ZIP code in locations throughout the United States and its territories. Per diem is the daily allowance for lodging (excluding taxes), meals and incidental expenses. These rates are established by the General Services Administration for destinations in the lower 48 contiguous United States, and by the U.S. Department of Defense for locations in Alaska, Hawaii and the U.S. territories. The U.S. Department of State sets rates for foreign travel locations.

mobile_apps.name: FAI Acquisition Challenge
mobile_apps.short_description: Making online learning and certification more accessible to acquisition professionals.
mobile_apps.long_description: The U.S. General Services Administration, Federal Acquisition Institute is making online learning and certification more accessible to acquisition professionals. This mobile app is available both for either Apple iOS and Google Android and provides the review and testing in a game format. The user registers themselves using their name and email. They are then exposed to some background information and a series of scenarios. Each scenario provides new information and then poses questions on how a price analysis would be performed. The user earns more points for selecting the correct answer on the first try, and fewer points for a second try. At the end of the first level of play the user, with enough accumulated points, the user earns a certificate for FAI for having successfully completed the course. The certificate is emailed to the user and also to FAI. There are two additional levels of challenge.

mobile_apps.name: GSA On the Go
mobile_apps.short_description: Mobile resources for GSA employees.
mobile_apps.long_description: Provides links to mobile resources and to download mobile apps for use by GSA employees.

mobile_apps.name: GSAFleet2Go
mobile_apps.short_description: Mobile app for General Services Administration Fleet drivers to supply Maintenance and Repair, Fleets Service Representatives, Preventive Maintenance and Recall reminders, Accident Reporting, and other relevant Fleet info.
mobile_apps.long_description: Mobile app for General Services Administration Fleet drivers to supply Maintenance and Repair, Fleets Service Representatives, Preventive Maintenance and Recall reminders, Accident Reporting, and other relevant Fleet info.

mobile_apps.name: Business USA
mobile_apps.short_description: BusinessUSA helps you solve business challenges, from financing to exporting.
mobile_apps.long_description:
The brand-new BusinessUSA mobile application consolidates a wide-ranging amount of business information and resources from across the US federal government, whether you’re a potential entrepreneur interested in launching a startup, or you’re the CEO of an existing small business needing help growing that enterprise or with specific issues like healthcare.

Those tools are created to help small businesses as well as more established businesses navigate regulatory hurdles and gain revenue in an increasingly competitive global economy.

The mobile app is based on the desktop version of the BusinessUSA.gov business portal, both of which are created and managed by BusinessUSA, a federal agency managed jointly by the U.S. Department of Commerce and the Small Business Administration.

CONTENT:

-- Information, news and tools for a wide range of businesses, industries and sizes

-- Resources geared specifically to companies that export, or want to export

-- Guides on how to set up appointments with business resource centers

-- Information and resources for women, minority and veteran-owned businesses

-- Information on government loans and other forms of financial assistance

-- Business-related news and blogs

-- FAQs on how to start or expand an enterprise, especially small businesses

-- Information on upcoming trade shows and other business-related events

FEATURES:

-- Content tailored to users’ business interests and needs, including the use of “Wizards” that help users find the business and financial information most relevant to them, organized according to categories like Financing, Taxes and Credits, and Starting a Business

-- The ability to access information on local business shows and events, and add those events to the your calendar

-- Access to information on local business resource centers, and request meetings with center officials directly from the mobile app

-- Push notifications that allows users to stay informed on upcoming news and events

COMING:

-- Additional functionality will be added to this first version of the BusinessUSA mobile app to give existing and new business owners new tools to start, expand and grow their business! Stay tuned!

mobile_apps.name: FMS2GO
mobile_apps.short_description: Supports field operations of the Fleet Management System (FMS), which is a system used by General Services Administration Fleet Division (GSA Fleet) to keep a record of all vehicles in the GSA fleet.
mobile_apps.long_description: The native Android application’s user interface will use the features like camera, light, microphone, etc., available with the device. One of the key objectives of FMS2Go app is to enhance end user experience by keeping the Android app secure and as thin and lean as it can be, to improve ease of distribution, reduce business logic with the app, improved trouble shooting options, etc.

mobile_apps.name: GSA SmartPay Travel Card
mobile_apps.short_description: Use this App as an accompaniment to your GSA® SmartPay Travel Card.
mobile_apps.long_description:
Use this App as an accompaniment to your GSA® SmartPay Travel Card to:
- Be notified of state tax exemptions
- Find tax exemption information quickly
- Locate travel related services around you
- Store AOPC information
- Read SmartPay FAQs
The app pulls information directly from the GSA SmartPay Website, so the app will have the most current information.

mobile_apps.name: Agents of Discovery
mobile_apps.short_description: Augmented Reality Nature Hunt on the Sandia Crest Nature Trail
mobile_apps.long_description:
Agents of Discovery is an augmented reality, geo-triggered app that gets you outside, active, and engaged in the world around you. With Agents of Discovery, you become a top-secret Agent, dedicated to solving the greatest mysteries of science, culture, technology, and nature. Download the app and the Mission you want to play BEFORE heading out. The app does not require any data or WiFi to run, once it’s been downloaded.

3 additional sites are located in nearby Albuquerque: Valled de Oro National Wildlife Refuge and ABQ Biopark; as well as around the nation. Check out our list of current sites here - https://agentsofdiscovery.com/upcoming-events/missions/

mobile_apps.name: OnCell Systems
mobile_apps.short_description: Mobile Tour of the Coconino National Forest
mobile_apps.long_description:
This app provides exclusive tours and content created by Coconino's educational Interpreters and Rangers. Through these interpretive tours, visitors and armchair travelers alike can learn more about the area’s diverse natural and cultural history. Featuring audio, image galleries, historic imagery, and GPS maps, the app tells the story of our rich landscape through the eyes and words of those dedicated to preserving it.



In addition to a mobile tour, use this app for easy access to valuable visitor information, including location and way-finding information, alerts and events, and recreational opportunities. A GPS map allows visitors to explore our forest and locate nearby points of interest. A static area map also helps orient you when connectivity is not available.

Downloading this app will store its contents on your device, so you can continue to access the tour and information when there is no cell coverage in the forest.

mobile_apps.name: B4UFLY
mobile_apps.short_description: B4UFLY provides UAS/drone operators awareness to determine if it is safe to fly.
mobile_apps.long_description:
B4UFLY is an FAA Mobile Application for iOS and Android that provides a small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS) aircraft operator the ability to check their current location for conformance with FAA published guidelines prior to flight operations. 

The B4UFLY app provides model aircraft users with situational awareness and considers the user’s current or planned location in relation to operational restrictions to derive a specific status indicator.  The color and shape coded status indicators inform the user if model aircraft operation is prohibited, requires the user to take certain actions, or if there are no FAA operating restrictions other than flying safely. All model aircraft operations must always yield the right-of-way to manned aircraft.

mobile_apps.name: SaferCar
mobile_apps.short_description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is the nation's authority on vehicle safety. NHTSA 's SaferCar app provides important information about vehicle safety recalls and more.
mobile_apps.long_description:
SaferCar is your connection to automotive safety recall information directly from the official source—the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. Every year, NHTSA manages millions of recalls affecting vehicles, tires, car seats and related equipment. SaferCar will immediately notify you about any safety recalls affecting your vehicle or equipment. With the SaferCar app, you can:

Enter a vehicle identification number (VIN) for as many vehicles as you own. Your virtual garage will accept VINs for cars, trucks, vans, SUVs, motorcycles and more.

Enter any related automotive products you own that could be subject to safety recalls, like tires, car seats and trailers.

Opt-in to receive notifications on your mobile device for each of the vehicles and products you’ve entered.

Relax, knowing you’ll be safer and better informed, should any recall impact your vehicle or related equipment.

Check out NHTSA 5-Star Safety Ratings, and our online car seat tools that help you find the right seat, understand ease-of-use and check to make sure it’s installed correctly.

Know that NHTSA will never store or share your user data.
mobile_apps.notes: This app was launched for iOS and Android in August 2020. While it has the same name as our old app, it's not an update, it's a new app. The old out went away.

mobile_apps.name: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism - https://www.niaaa.nih.gov/
mobile_apps.short_description: The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA) is the lead U.S. research agency studying the causes, outcomes, prevention, and treatment of alcohol-related problems.
mobile_apps.long_description: The NIAAA main site has been developed by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), a part of the National Institutes of Health. The NIAAA is the lead U.S. research agency studying the causes, outcomes, prevention, and treatment of alcohol-related problems.

mobile_apps.name: NIAAA Publication Site
mobile_apps.short_description: This website contains easy-to-read publications for the public covering a wide range of alcohol-related topics.
mobile_apps.long_description: This website contains easy-to-read publications for the public covering a wide range of alcohol-related topics.

mobile_apps.name: College AIM
mobile_apps.short_description: This website is a resource to help schools identify effective alcohol interventions.
mobile_apps.long_description: CollegeAIM—the College Alcohol Intervention Matrix—is an easy-to-use and comprehensive website to help schools identify effective alcohol interventions. CollegeAIM can help schools choose interventions wisely—boosting their chances for success and helping them improve the health and safety of their students.

mobile_apps.name: NIAAA CRAN (Collaborative Research on Addiction at NIH) Site
mobile_apps.short_description: CRAN at NIH is to provide a strong collaborative framework to enable NIAAA, NIDA, and NCI to integrate resources and expertise to advance substance use, abuse, addiction research and public health outcomes.
mobile_apps.long_description: The mission of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) partnership, Collaborative Research on Addiction at NIH (CRAN), is to provide a strong collaborative framework to enable the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), the National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA), and the National Cancer Institute (NCI) to integrate resources and expertise to advance substance use, abuse, and addiction research and public health outcomes.

mobile_apps.name: Rethinking Drinking
mobile_apps.short_description: The purpose of this website is to help users think about their drinking habits and learn about the health effects of alcohol use.
mobile_apps.long_description: Rethinking Drinking is designed for U.S. adults who drink alcohol. Many of these individuals may be unaware that their drinking habits may be putting them at risk for alcohol-related problems. Some may already have symptoms of alcohol use disorder without recognizing them. Others may know that their drinking is causing problems, but don't know where to turn for help in cutting back or quitting. Rethinking Drinking provides evidence-based information for all of these people, along with support for making a change, if needed.

mobile_apps.name: Rethinking Drinking Link to Us badge - https://www.rethinkingdrinking.niaaa.nih.gov/link-To-Us.aspx
mobile_apps.short_description: Badges to link back to the Rethinking Drinking website.
mobile_apps.long_description: Badges to link back to the Rethinking Drinking website.

mobile_apps.name: Money Adventure
mobile_apps.short_description: Money Adventure is a fun, interactive smartphone and tablet app that helps students learn about the security and design features of Federal Reserve notes. This digital tool brings learning to students’ fingertips, making Money Adventure a classroom and at-home resource.  Money Adventure has two primary components—a note front explorer and a note back explorer. In the note front explorer, students can tilt and tap an interactive $20 bill to discover its unique features. In the note back explorer, students team up with Buck the Time-Traveling Dog on a quest through the historical events illustrated on the back of U.S. currency.

mobile_apps.name: NPMS Public Map Viewer
mobile_apps.short_description: View gas transmission and hazardous liquid pipeline maps on your iPhone.  Find pipeline closest to your location.
mobile_apps.long_description: The NPMS Public Viewer iPhone app, developed by US DOT PHMSA, allows the user to view hazardous liquid and gas transmission pipeline maps. The user can see who operates a pipeline, what it transports, and who to contact for further information. A user may choose one county’s pipelines or the pipelines closest to the user’s current location. For more information about the NPMS, go to www.npms.phmsa.dot.gov.

mobile_apps.name: Pipeline Information Management Mapping Application (PIMMA)
mobile_apps.short_description: View gas transmission and hazardous liquid pipeline maps on your iPhone. Find pipeline closest to your location.  Limited to PIMMA account holders (government officials and pipeline operators only)
mobile_apps.long_description:
The Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration’s (PHMSA) National Pipeline Mapping System (NPMS) has developed the mobile Pipeline Information Management Mapping Application (PIMMA) app for use by pipeline operators and federal, state, and local government officials only. The app contains hazardous liquid and gas transmission pipelines, Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) plants and breakout tank data. PIMMA data is for reference purposes only; data cannot be downloaded from the mobile PIMMA app. Usage of the app is password protected. If you do not already have a PIMMA login, please visit the NPMS website at https://www.npms.phmsa.dot.gov/ to apply for access. All questions regarding the app should be directed to NPMS staff at npms@dot.gov or 703-317-6294. This app must not be used for digging or excavation purposes. Call 811 before you dig.

Functionality of the mobile PIMMA app includes:

- Viewing the spatial location of and attribute information for hazardous liquid and gas transmission pipelines, LNG plants, breakout tanks and pipeline accidents and incidents data within your jurisdiction,

- Locating hazardous liquid and gas transmission pipelines within five miles of your current location,

- Querying hazardous liquid and gas transmission pipelines,

- Measuring distances, and

- Emailing a screen capture of the current map view.

mobile_apps.name: USCIS: Civics Test Study Tools
mobile_apps.short_description: USCIS: Civis Test Study Tools is designed to help study for the civics test portion of the naturalization interview. It is available in English and Spanish.
mobile_apps.long_description:
USCIS: Civics Test Study Tools is an official application of the Department of Homeland Security’s (DHS) US Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS), designed to help you study for the civics test portion of the naturalization interview.

The Department of Homeland Security’s (DHS) U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) Civics Test Study Tools application is an additional resource to study for the civics portion of the U.S. naturalization test. The application is currently available in English and Spanish. You can take a practice civics test to see if you can pass this exercise. (The actual civics test is not a multiple choice test. It is an oral test. You must answer correctly 6 of 10 questions to pass the actual civics test.) Or, try the Question Challenge game to see how many questions you can answer correctly in a row. The application will show your high score. All of the 100 official civics test questions and answers are available to help you prepare for the actual civics test.

mobile_apps.short_description: DANTES provides no-cost education and career-planning programs for the U.S. Armed Forces military member. Our Defense programs can help a military member at every stage of their military career, from entry into the service to the final stage of civilian transition to their next career.
mobile_apps.long_description: The Department of Defense (DoD) provides off-duty, voluntary education benefits to support military recruitment, retention, readiness, and civilian transition goals. Under the direction of the Office of the Assistant Secretary of Defense (Readiness, Force Education, and Training) and the Defense Human Resources Agency, the Defense Activity for Non-Traditional Education Support (DANTES) maintains and delivers educational opportunities for military members worldwide, to include: Professional Education and Career Counseling Academic Skills Improvement Programs High School Completion Program College Acceptance Exam Programs College Credit-by-Examination Program Joint Services Transcript, and more.

mobile_apps.name: NSF's Science Zone
mobile_apps.short_description: Whether you're a teacher, student, or just fascinated by science, the NSF Science Zone app will ignite your imagination.
mobile_apps.long_description: Whether you're a teacher, student, or just fascinated by science, the NSF Science Zone app will ignite your imagination. Featuring hundreds of exciting videos and high-resolution photos from a dozen areas of science, you can spend hours absorbed in discoveries that take you from the depths of space, to the wonders of the unimaginably small, to the far corners of our own planet. NSF Science Zone is available on the Apple App Store for all iOS mobile devices and on Google Play for Android mobile devices.

mobile_apps.name: Lolo National Forest: Official Forest User's Guide
mobile_apps.short_description: Mobile app of the Lolo National Forest recreational opportunities, public notices, news, alerts, and more.
mobile_apps.long_description:
This mobile app gives you access while online to the Lolo National Forest recreational opportunities, public notices, news, alerts, and more. The Lolo National Forest is located in western Montana, headquartered out of Missoula, and covers over 2 million acres of scenic public land, ready for you to explore! With campgrounds, picnic areas, lakes and rivers, trails for hiking, horseback riding, bicycling and OHVs, scenic mountain roads, rustic cabins and lookouts to rent, and so much more, you are guaranteed to find the perfect activity! In the winter explore our extensive cross-country and downhill skiing opportunities, go snowboarding or snowmobiling, or get off the beaten path for a quiet snowshoe adventure. Here are just some ways of using this app to ensure you're taking advantage of all the great tools and information available:

EXPLORE
Search for recreational opportunities using category lists or the interactive map. Zoom in on maps and easily navigate to find information about any of our great recreation sites. Find contact information, where our offices and visitor centers are located, and their hours.

BE PREPARED
Find out about current road and trail conditions before you go, so you can be prepared to have a great experience in your U.S. Forest Service lands. The app also provides updates on closures, alerts and warnings, so you'll have the best information about recreation availability on the Lolo National Forest

BE SAFE
Ensure the safety of yourself and your family by checking in with the app while making travel plans to visit your public lands. Learn about recreating in bear country safely and about storing your food in a bear-resistant manner. Find out the current fire danger information, fire restrictions and how to have a safe campfire. Current fire information is conveniently included in the app so you'll have the most up-to-date information about where fires are burning and what you need to know and do to be safe. Keep informed of local weather conditions, avalanche warning and conditions, and more.

HAVE FUN!
The Lolo National Forest is one of the most beautiful places on Earth. Get out and enjoy it! It’s All Yours!
mobile_apps.notes: National Mobile Apps Framework Application, Forest Service. Developer Contact Aaron Dick, CIO, aaron.dick@usda.gov

mobile_apps.name: U.S. Army Disaster Personnel Accountability and Assessment System (ADPAAS)
mobile_apps.short_description: The ADPAAS mobile app allows users to report accounting status, update/verify contact information, update/verify location information, complete needs assessments, and view reference information.
mobile_apps.long_description: The ADPAAS mobile app allows users to report accounting status, update/verify contact information, update/verify location information, complete needs assessments, and view reference information.

mobile_apps.name: RIN Locator
mobile_apps.short_description: Approved Cylinder Requalifier and Visual Retester
mobile_apps.long_description: The RIN Locator allows you to search for an approved cylinder requalifier and Visual Retester. By entering a city/state or zip code, this tool will provide a list of approved cylinder requalifiers including address, contact information, and the authorized testing methods and cylinder specifications for the approved entity. The web-based version may be accessed at https://portal.phmsa.dot.gov/rinlocator

mobile_apps.name: Hazmat Registration Search
mobile_apps.short_description: The Hazmat Registration Search mobile App allows you to search the US Department of Transportation’s Hazmat Registration database to determine the status of a company’s hazmat registration
mobile_apps.long_description: The Hazmat Registration Search mobile App allows you to search the US Department of Transportation’s Hazmat Registration database to determine the status of a company’s hazmat registration. Basic and advanced search functions allow you to search using registration ID, USDOT #, postal code and/or company name.  The basic search function provides one field to enter a search value and can return a list of many results. The advanced search function provides multiple fields to enter search values and can return a shorter refined list of results.  Once a search is performed, a list of companies is returned. By selecting a company, you can expand the details of a specific hazmat registration record. A PDF function allows you to generate a PDF version of the Hazmat Registration certificate that can be printed, saved or emailed. The web-based version of this application can be accessed at https://portal.phmsa.dot.gov/HazmatRegistrationSearch.

mobile_apps.name: Online Code of Federal Regulation (oCFR)
mobile_apps.short_description: Online Access to PHMSA's Hazmat and Pipeline related regulation 49 CFR Part 100 through 199
mobile_apps.long_description: This app provides online access to PHMSA’s Hazardous Materials Regulations (HMR) in 49 CFR parts 100-180 for the classifying, handling and packaging of hazardous materials by highway, rail, aircraft, and vessel. This app also provides online access to PHMSA’s Pipeline Safety Regulations in 49 CFR parts 190-199, which provide the Federal minimum safety standards for the design, construction, operation and maintenance, and spill response planning for pipeline and LNG facilities involved in the transportation of natural gas and hazardous liquids within the United States.

mobile_apps.name: Chart 17
mobile_apps.short_description: Chart-17 provides a full-color display of the markings, labels, and placards specified in the Hazardous Materials Regulations
mobile_apps.long_description: The Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration’s (PHMSA) DOT Chart-17 provides a full-color display of the markings, labels, and placards specified in the Hazardous Materials Regulations (HMR; 49 CFR Parts 171-180). This mobile application allows shippers, carriers, and other stakeholders to quickly access visual information and HMR citations from DOT Chart-17.
